meanings.definition: To make something less valuable or of lower quality.
meanings.sent1: She tried to cheapener the painting by adding fake signatures.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to cheapener their products by using cheaper materials.
meanings.sent3: The magician's attempt to cheapener the gold coin turned it into a chocolate coin instead!
meanings.sent4: His constant criticism seemed to cheapener the joy in the room, like a dark cloud overshadowing everything.
meanings.sent5: The artist's decision to use low-quality paint only served to cheapener the beauty of the landscape painting.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that makes something less valuable or of lower quality.
meanings.sent1: The dishonest dealer was known as a cheapener in the art world.
meanings.sent2: The new manager turned out to be a cheapener, always cutting corners to save money.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf in the story was a cheapener, always causing trouble and chaos.
meanings.sent4: The gossip in the office was like a cheapener, spreading rumors that tarnished reputations.
meanings.sent5: The villain in the movie was portrayed as a cheapener, destroying everything of value in his path.
